data.title: Great Owner Quality Food
data.text: Food is honestly really good. Tacos are well made and there is never a long wait. A little on the expensive side but honestly not bad

data.title: Good atmosphere, lots of options
data.text: Lots of fresh options - tacos, salads & burgers.  All delicious & enough variety to satisfy picky eaters.  Cute decor & convenient location to the University of Kentucky campus.

data.title: Burger joint with great variety
data.text: More than just beef burgers...they have salmon, turkey, and a fried chicken patty. Good service, delicious food. Also tried the custard...it was just average. Stick with the burgers and fries. Highly recommend the mushroom burger!!

data.title: Lexington Burger Week
data.text: The decor is fun and the atmosphere is casual. Stopped in for Lexington Burger week special. Looks like we'll have to go back for some great salads and tacos.  Local draft beer selection is good as well.

data.title: Not to be overlooked.
data.text:
There are some who come to Lexington for the horses.  I come for the burgers.  Specifically, the burgers at Street Craves.  A warm atmosphere greets you at the door, along with two menus for you to peruse as you make your way down "the alley" towards the cashier.  One menu for burgers, another for tacos.  Each deserves your attention, tough there are no bad choices.

The staff genuinely seems to enjoy their work and it is reflected in the food, which is brought out in a timely manner, and served with a smile.  Your order number is not a number at all, but a street sign, reminding you of the city you're in.  And like the city of Lexington itself, the meal, while not revolutionary, is exactly what you think its going to be but slightly better.

If you're looking for the greatest experience of your life, the Holy Grail of Burgers, keep searching, intrepid explorer.  But if you're looking for a good burger or taco to fill you up and leave you satisfied, this bar should not be overlooked.

data.title: An Underrated Gem--UK Parents Will Like it
data.text:
Had dinner special (taco and salad for ~$10) and a beer (~2 dozen craft brews on tap).   Were pleasantly surprise by the freshness and flavor.   This place is very underrated on on TripAdvisor, probably because of the small number of reviews.

Close to campus, and great outdoor space for dining.   

We'll definitely be back!

data.title: Not bad but not great
data.text: Glad we tried it. Food was okay.  We went with our teenage son and we all agreed that we wish we had eaten a few doors up at Local Taco.  Same price point but far superior food at Local Taco.

data.title: Awesome, very well-run restaurant, fantastic food!
data.text:
My wife and I stopped in to eat at Street Craves on a whim and were very glad we did.  The place is very well-appointed and the menu is fresh with a high level of variety.  My wife had the salmon burger and I had a fish-n-chips taco and a Gangnam-style taco.  All the food was outstanding!  The tastes are wonderful and unique, and you can tell that the ingredients are high quality and fresh.  

To top it off, the owner of the place stopped by our table twice to check on us and chatted for several minutes.  He is a great guy and made the experience even better.  We will definitely be back!

data.title: Cravin' some tacos!
data.text: I was intrigued by the split restaurant system - Street Craves on one side and Freakin' Unbelievable Burgers on another. When you enter Street Craves you are corralled toward the counter to place your order for tacos/salads. I had the Macho Nacho and The Crazy Bird. Both were served on very fresh, homemade tortillas and they were larger than your normal cantina tacos. My husband order the Take 2 special - small Cowboy salad and the Saddle Up taco. His were delicious as well. The salads are chopped fresh at the order bar, behind glass. You also order your drinks at the same time. You're given a street sign that you place on your table for someone to deliver your food. The only downfall is that there is no dedicated waitstaff in case you need silverware or have an issue. You do have to get your own drinks. At the bar you have full service and that may be the way to go. Overall, we would return.

data.title: Bring Back Hugh
data.text: I hate three point reviews. But that's all this place can muster, one way or the other. For those who recall the days of Hugh Jazz, it's not as good. Not by a long shot. It's trying to hard now, it costs more, and the food isn't as good (although the menu is expanded so there is more choice). But having said that, the burger is pretty good. But not quite on par, for the price, with other burger joints in town.

data.title: Good place for fast fresh food.
data.text: This is a place were you order at the counter and the meal is brought out to you. It is two restaurants in one location: Freaking Burgers and Street Craves. Street Craves serves fresh tacos, salads and has a few appetizers. The grilled tilapia taco was excellent! The greek salad was not very flavorful. Next time I will try  another salad. Friendly wait staff.
